input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Gender has a direct effect on occupation and salary. Skill has a direct effect on occupation and salary. Occupation has a direct effect on salary. Skill is unobserved. The overall probability of male gender is 13%. The probability of non-male gender and high salary is 41%. The probability of male gender and high salary is 5%. Is the chance of high salary larger when observing male gender?
